fields.description:
As a Jira Work Management admin, I would like to use Forms by decoupling it from the Create Issues permission. 

This is how I would like it to behave:
-  Users throughout the company can use Forms instead of the regular
Create Issue view to report issues to other project teams.

Context: 
- Users throughout the company have read and comment access to most
projects.
- Only users who participate actively in a project have Issue Create
access.

This way, any logged-in user could use the form to report issues.
fields.summary: Forms user access permission

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Users will see 2 filter buttons in JWM Timeline

However the functionality is not impacted, customers can still filter properly

!image-2021-09-13-14-50-13-858.png|width=762,height=196!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Visit JWM timeline

h3. Expected Results

Only 1 button is visible
h3. Actual Results

2 buttons are visible
h3. Workaround

There is none, it doesn't degrade the functionality of timeline
fields.summary: User viewing JWM timeline will see double Filter button

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When disabling Issue Linking, dependencies are not removed from Timeline and when a user tries to unlink issues, it just blinks and the dependency shows again with no indication of what is causing the issue.

On Jira Software, the dependencies disappear from the Roadmap.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Link issues on the Timeline.
 # Disable Issue Linking (Cog icon > Issues > Issue Linking).

h3. Expected Results

The dependencies are removed from the Timeline since the feature is disabled.
h3. Actual Results

The dependencies are still visible on the Timeline (even though it doesn’t show on the ticket itself) and when trying to remove them, it disappears and appears again.

Nothing is shown on developer tools.

On Splunk it points to the error:
{noformat}
Error performing JWMUnlinkItemsMutation mutation. Operation: gira-jbus-RemoveJWMDependencyTimelineView, Errors: Issue linking is currently disabled.
{noformat}
h3. !Screen Recording 2021-09-09 at 10.08.43 AM.gif|width=396,height=189!
h3. Workaround

Enable issue linking, remove all the dependencies and disable it again.
fields.summary: Disabling Issue Linking won’t remove dependencies on the Timeline

fields.description:
Currently only limited type of custom fields are allowed in the list view as per the details available here-
https://support.atlassian.com/jira-work-management/docs/view-your-work-in-a-list/#Jira-custom-fields

Have other type of issues(like checkboxes) in the list would be really appriciated.
fields.summary: Add more type of custom fields in list view

fields.description:
At the moment *Insight Object Type* custom fields is not support in JWM List View.
We would like to be able to add the Insight custom fields to the List View for example *Vendor*.
fields.summary: Ability to add JSM Insight Object Type custom fields in JWM List View

fields.description:
As a user of the timeline view

I would like to be able to select multiple issues

so that I can adjust the start and end dates of several issues at once (especially dependent issues).

 

Asana's timeline view is a great example of how this works well.
fields.summary: Multi-Select and adjustment of dates of Issues in Timeline view

fields.description: We would like to be able to sort the List view by a specific sort order (in our case Priority Desc) for all users of the project by default.  They should still be able to apply their own sort orders/filters, but this should be default.  It appears that this can be done on a per-user basis but not project-level.
fields.summary: Allow configuration of list default sort order

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Creating a subtask from List pulls up the Create Screen (when a required field is on the screen) with only *Task* as an Option.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a project with Task & Subtask Issue type
# Set a required field on Field Configuration used by Subtasks
# Go to the *List* section of the project
# Used the "+" button on any parent Task to create a subtask
 !create-from-list.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Expected Results
The pop-up create screen should have the Subtask issue type

h3. Actual Results
The screen to create the issue will be open and the type will be set to the Task issue type, no other option.

h3. Workaround
Create the subtask from the parent issue view OR remove the required field from the create screen, to avoid the create screen pop-up.
fields.summary: Creating a subtask from List pulls up create screen with only Task as an issue type option

fields.description: We need the ability to create more quick-filters any field, for example the ability to filter by component
fields.summary: Ability to create QuickFilters on any board

fields.description:
Hello! :) 

As a Project Admin, I would like to set a default view for the ListView/s in a configuration.

Because I want the Users of the Project to all experience the basic setup the View is intended to deliver.

Each Projects ListView should have it's own predefined view of content, which is independent from the users settings of view preferences.

In One Project the Due Date may be necessary on the other it may not.

 

At the Moment the Users settings are defining how all lists across the site are looking.

We have multiple WorkManagement Projects and currently, after I set one view on one project all my views are suddenly the same on all projects.

 

Thank you very much.

I hope this will be added very soon.

Cheers

// Patric
fields.summary: ListView Configuration per Project

fields.description:
Currently, the JWM list allows displaying columns for issue creation and update, but there is no way to add a column for the Issue Resolved date

Please provide the ability to display that field in the list view.
fields.summary: Ability to display the Resolved date in JWM projects list view

fields.description:
While rollingout, new JWM board, the sub-tasks icon got changed.
 !Screenshot 2021-08-31 at 12.05.12 PM.png|thumbnail! 

My test Instance looks like:
 !Screenshot 2021-08-31 at 8.15.41 AM.png|thumbnail! 

With the new chnage in place, we need to explicitly hover the mouse to see the count of completed vs total sub-tasks which seems less user-frindly as compared to the older functionality.

Please enable the exact sub-task count to be visible over the JWM board.
fields.summary: Subtask checklist on JWM board is not showing the exact count on subtask checklist

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Same project background color is shown for multiple JWM projects when projects are opened in the same browser tab

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a JWM project (Project X) and apply a project background color
# Now open another project (Project Y) in the same browser tab
# Project Y background color will be the same as the Project X

h3. Expected Results
Project background colors are unique to projects and should show applied background color when opened in the same browser tab

h3. Actual Results
The same project background color is shown for all the JWM projects when opened in the same tab

h3. Workaround
Open each JWM project in different tabs so that the respective project background color is displayed
fields.summary: Project background color stays the same for multiple JWM projects

fields.description:
Our team is now large enough that we break down work by product area, using components.
We would like to have the ability to quickly filter by a component.
fields.summary: Add Custom Quick-filters to all views

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
User status still displays *No Activity* even after the user already logged in to the instance. When open their profile , it show *Never seen on this site*

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # As site-admin , invite a user
 # Go to the user email inbox, he should receive invitation email from JIRA
# Complete the registration and login to the instance.
# Create an issue or view any issue

h3. Expected Results
User status from User Management page doesn't show "No Activity" and in the profile updated with Last Seen information

h3. Actual Results
User status from User Management page show "No Activity" and in the profile show "Never seen on this site"

h3. Notes
It will not affect the user login. Note that the last activity data can be delayed up to 4 hours.

 !Screen Shot 2021-06-22 at 11.13.59.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: User status at User Management still showing "No activity" even though the user has logged in to the instance

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When we create an Issue via JWM Board, the default value for a custom field gets updated but when we create issue via List, the custom field value is not set.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to Business Project List and create an issue.
 !Screenshot 2021-08-31 at 9.00.26 AM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The Default value of a custom field should get auto-set on issue-view, post issue creation

h3. Actual Results
The custom field is empty

- We see the following informarion with further investigation:
 !Screenshot 2021-08-31 at 9.03.01 AM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Create Issue from JWM Board using the global "Create" option.
fields.summary: Business project's list which doesn’t acknowledge the default values of custom fields

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a business board has many issues shown in the in progress and done columns, the scroll bar is trying to show as much information as possible, but this makes that when you click create issue in the to do column (with fewer issues) and just click outside the text box (not creating the issue) the create button gets hidden behind the name of the column.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to a board where the in progress or done columns have more issues than the to do column
 # Click create issue
 # Click outside the text box (cancelling issue creation)
 # Create issue is not shown because it's hidden
 # Video attached showing the behavior

h3. Expected Results

Create issue button should be correctly shown
h3. Actual Results

[^Screen Recording 2021-08-27 at 15.04.54.mov]
h3. Workaround

Scroll the page up to show the button again
fields.summary: Create issue button gets hidden at the top if in progress or done columns are showing more issues than to do

fields.description:
We would like to have the ability to "Flag" issues in Jira business projects with an "Impediment" flag, as we have in the Jira software project.

Documentation for Software: https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/flag-an-issue/
fields.summary: Add a option to Flag an issue in JWM

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you have any of the supported fields as required and it is not included in the _Create issue_ operation screen, your *Forms* will fail to preview and show *Form is unavailable*.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Remove the *Summary* field from the _Create issue_ screen of the project (this field is already mandatory)
# Make sure to add the *Summary* field to your submission form
# Click on *Preview*

h3. Expected Results

The form should open in a new tab giving you a preview of how it looks.

h3. Actual Results

The form breaks despite already having the *Summary* field included but because it's missing from the screens.

 !Form_submission_-_Project_Management_-_Jira.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

For the form to work, the required fields must also be included in the _Create issue_ screen of your project.
fields.summary: Cannot preview forms if required fields are missing from the Create issue screen

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

At this moment, it is not possible to resize the width of the columns of JWM project and it is not in full screen. Some would like it full screen and some may like the shrunk view. 
h3. Suggested Solution

Add the ability for users to resize the width of the columns per their requirement.
h3. Why this is important

This feature would greatly improve the user experience.
fields.summary: Ability to resize the width of the columns per the requirement of users

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Story point custom field values are not displayed in JWM list view.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Add story points custom field to project edit/view screens and context
 * In project List view add story points field
 * No values are being displayed in the Story point field in the JWM list view even though the field is populated for the issue

If the jira issue is opened from the JWM list view and closed, the story point field gets updated only for the opened issue.
h3. Expected Results

The story points custom field value should be displayed for all the Jira issues in the JWM list view
h3. Actual Results

The Story point custom field value is shown as blank for all issues in the list view.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Story point custom field values are not displayed in JWM list view

fields.description: I would really like to have the Next-Gen/ Team Managed Projects feature available in Jira Work Management Cloud. So far it does not seem this feature is available except in Jira Software Cloud. The ability to allow for private projects to track individual tasks and work without cluttering up the team or organization "project list" would be very useful.
fields.summary: Next-Gen/ Team Managed Projects

fields.description: We would like to have Data Residency feature for Jira Work Management(JWM) product as well same as JSW,Confluence and JSM as stated in this [document|https://support.atlassian.com/security-and-access-policies/docs/understand-data-residency/].
fields.summary: Data Residency for Jira Work Management

fields.description:
It would be nice to add the ability to include the default value and the description set for the custom fields in Jira Work Management project forms.

*Use case:* It is important for the user to know the description of the field so that they can fill in the details accordingly.
fields.summary: Add the ability to include the default value for the custom fields in Jira Work Management project forms.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating a new issue on the List view of a Business project if there is a required field a modal will open to fill, after filling the information and clicking on create the modal will stay open with the information loaded allowing the user to create multiple issues.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On a Company-managed business project with required fields go to the List view
 # Click on the create button at the bottom of the list
 # Fill the summary and hit enter
 # On the modal opened fill the required fields and click on create

!listCreate.gif|width=599,height=347!
h3. Expected Results
 * The issue should be created and the modal should disappear

h3. Actual Results
 * The issue is created but the modal is still there allowing the user to erroneously create multiple issues with the same informaton

h3. Workaround

After creating each issue manually closing the modal.
fields.summary: Creating a new issue in the List view does not close the modal

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Copy link in 'List' view does not work

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to 'List' view 
# Hover over the issue key, click 'Copy link' icon
 !image-2021-08-16-14-46-16-220.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
It should copy the full issue URL

h3. Actual Results
It copies an invalid URL

h3. Workaround
# Click on the issue key, it will open in card view
# Click on 'Copy link to issue' to copy the full issue key URL
fields.summary: Copy link in list view does not work

fields.description:
As a project manager, I would like option for subtasks to be nested in the JWM list view so that I can more easily see the scope of a project's work. 
 
 
This would behave similar to the JWM timeline subtask nesting or the nesting found in the list view of Work management competitors like Asana, Clickup, etc. 
 
 
!image-2021-08-12-10-54-20-603.png!
fields.summary: Nested subtasks on List view

fields.description:
The new calendar view is great to quickly visualize the workload for the incoming days. However, we want new ways to filter the visible stories in the calendar. 

Bring the possibility to filter the stories by issue type in the calendar view: 

 !image-2021-08-11-13-03-22-638.png|thumbnail! 

This will be excellent since the Work management project filter can't modify and it supports up to 1000 stories. It would be hard to visualize and manage 1000 stories in a single month's view.
fields.summary: Add filter options on the calendar View

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Timeline view freezes and not responsive if there is no issue created in the project yet
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a business project 
 # Straight go to Timeline View without creating any issues

h3. Expected Results

To be able to create the first issue via Timeline view
h3. Actual Results

The timeline view is unusable and frozen
h3. Workaround

Via Create issue view create the first issue then timeline view works fine
fields.summary: Timeline view freezes and not responsive if there is no issue created in the project (Empty timeline crashes.) yet

fields.description:
{panel:title=(i) Implementation of New Features Policy| borderStyle=| borderColor=| titleBGColor=#e0efff| bgColor=}
At the moment, we can't set an ETA for this feature to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes new features. Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
You can learn more by reading [Implementation of New Features Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/implementation-of-new-features-policy-201294576.html].
{panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently, JWM only allows the users to have only one *List*.

h3. Suggested Solution

Provide an option to have multiple *Lists* like Board.

h3. Workaround

None. Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
fields.summary: Ability to have multiple Lists per project

fields.description: Currently you can choose which fields will be displayed on the screen, but you cannot change their order. This feature makes it easy to get the information you need visually.
fields.summary: Ability to change the order of columns on Jira Business List views

fields.description: We need the ability to input multiple forms per project. most often there is more than one discipline on a project, and forms are usually for a specific discipline so we'd need the ability to have multiple forms to make it useful.
fields.summary: Jira work management - multiple forms
Possibility for non-admin users to create business projects also in sites with other Cloud products like JSW or JSM

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In a *Business Project*, when a User is using the TimeLine Page, the Inline Issue Creation feature is not available when a filter is applied. When the Filter is not applied, we get "+" option to Create a Sub-Task to a Standard Issue or to create a Standard Issue inside an Epic.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
  !Business Project Timeline.gif! 

h3. Expected Results

* Even when the filters are applied on the Timeline page the *Create Child Issue* "+" option should be allowed to Use. This will help when there are numerous issues in the timeline and the User wants to filter a few and then create Sub-Tasks.

h3. Actual Results

* No Create Child Issue "+" Option is available.

h3. Workaround

* The only way currently is to Apply the Filter and then Click on the Issue-key. This will open an Issue-View Pop-Up Window.
* Create Sub-Task or Child Issues from the Issue View.
fields.summary: In Business Project "Timeline" page, Inline Issue creation is not possible when a Filter is applied.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When moving an issue to another date on Timeline, if you try to change by only one day, the change is not kept. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access a Jira Work Management project > Timeline
# Drag and drop the issue estimation by one day

h3. Expected Results
The change should be kept
h3. Actual Results
The change is reverted: 
 [^Recording #7.mp4] 

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Dragging and dropping issues by one day on Timeline does not keep the change

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a user has the personal setting > Language set to Spanish, the days of the week shows, the wrong abbreviation. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access your Personal Settings > Language and change it to Spanish
# Refresh the page

h3. Expected Results
We should see the days of the week as: *L, M, X, J, V, S, D*

h3. Actual Results
It displays as: *L, M, X, M, V, D, D*

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Days of the week show in the wrong abbreviation if the language is set to Spanish

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
On Timeline, if you try to change *only one day* by dragging and dropping the date handles, the change you apply is reverted. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access a Jira Work Management project and click on Timeline, at the sidebar
# Drag and drop the date handles *by one day only*

h3. Expected Results
The change should be applied:
 [^Recording #6.mp4] 

h3. Actual Results
The change is reverted:


h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Dragging and dropping date handles on Timeline reverts the change if you change it by one day

fields.description:
Currently the timeline appears to display the first issue type or the main issue type as the title of the timeline table as shown in the attached screenshot.

Users could benefit from the ability to customize this text.

 !Screen Shot 2021-07-15 at 19.24.46.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Ability to customize the timeline title

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Improved User Management UI (Users and Groups under Org Directory) allows to Create Work Management/Business Projects to users without Administer Jira Global Permission.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Subscribe to Jira Work Management Product.
 # Add a User to the Site and grant a user role to the product
 # This user will be allowed to create Business Project, even though they do not have "*Administer Jira*" or "*Create Company-Managed business Project*" global permission.

h3. Expected Results
 * Users with the product role "user" should not be able to see the "*{color:#0747a6}Create Project{color}*" button on the UI.

h3. Actual Results
 * Users without the Administer Jira are allowed to Create New Company-Managed Business Projects.
     !image-2021-07-09-15-37-47-689.png|thumbnail! 
      !image-2021-07-09-15-34-26-289.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Workaround

There is no known workaround currently available for this behavior.
fields.summary: Improved User Management UI allows to Create Work Management/Business Projects to user without Admin Privileges.

fields.description: Currently it is not possible see the parent of an issue from the Lists, adding the parent field to the list of supported fields, or including any kind of feature to group subtask by their parent would be useful.
fields.summary: Allow grouping issues by parent in Lists

fields.description:
When moving issue statuses for customers with a high number of issue statuses it can be hard clicking the arrow multiple times to move the values because it takes a lot of time to reorder the statuses in the order they want.

*Suggestion:*
Please implement the move statuses by using a dropdown or a numbering order.
fields.summary: Move issue statuses by dropdown or numbering order

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Business project template Timeline view won't display sub-tasks

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Parent Task in the Timeline view
 # Create a few subtasks. At this point, you have the expand icon \/ to collapse to view the subtasks
# Refresh the screen cant see the subtask and the expand icon \/ disappeared

h3. Expected Results

To have expand icon \/ to be able to view the subtasks

h3. Actual Results

There is no expand icon \/ to able to view the subtasks

h3. Workaround

There is no workaround
fields.summary: Business project template Timeline view won't display subtasks

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The customer is unable to add Custom Field type *Select List (Single Choice)* to the List view on the Business project.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create custom field (Select List single choice type, Date picker, or Date time picker. )
# Add to issue screens of Business Project
# Browse Business project LIst view
# Try adding a new column and search for that new custom field

Please see this screen recording for reference:
 [^Screen Recording 2021-07-06 at 6.30.14 PM.mov] 

h3. Expected Results
According to this KB: https://support.atlassian.com/jira-work-management/docs/view-your-work-in-a-list/ 
*Select List (Single Choice)* should be available to add to the column.


h3. Actual Results
The *Select List (Single Choice)* type custom field is not listed in search fields to be added to the columns

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

h3. Update: 

*Date picker and Date time picker* are also having this same bug!
fields.summary: Unable to add Custom Field type *Select List (Single Choice) to the List view on the Business project

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Child issues are not being shown when the *Timeline* view is loaded, they just show after a new child is created, and in the case of the *Epic* issues, it's creating subtasks only it's not possible the select a standard issue type for the child issue.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to the Timeline view of a Business project
 # Click + to create a child issue
 # After the issue is created, the interface will show all the other children
 # For the Epic issues, subtasks are being created as children instead of the standard issue-type issues.

h3. Expected Results

The children should be shown since the 1st time the Timeline is rendered.

Also, standard issue-type issues should be created as children for Epics.
h3. Actual Results

See attached video for the results
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Inconsistencies with parent-child hierarchy in Timeline view for Business projects

fields.description:
Currently, one roadmap for one project. As an admin, managing all Epics in 1 single roadmap can be rather messy.

It would be great to be able to separate the Epics into few other boards.
fields.summary: Ability to create multiple basic roadmap for a single project

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In the Timeline view, the *Start date* and *Due date* for Tasks are presented by visual bars however they do not take into account the date values of its Sub-tasks.

h3. Proposed solution

An additional option should be added so users can choose to include or exclude the date values of Sub-tasks when viewing the Timeline for Tasks.
fields.summary: Timeline view Tasks should take Sub-tasks dates into account

fields.description: Having a list view is great, but being able to filter or group tasks based on any column would be very powerful.
fields.summary: Add filter & group by functionality in the List View for Jira Work Management

fields.description:
In Jira Work Management ( Bussiness porjects) when add multiple workflows for different issue types, the Board can't be loaded anymore with the attached message.

It will be nice to be able to maintain the board like software projects.
fields.summary: Jira Work Management : Ability to have multiple workflows for different issue type without losing the Board

fields.description:
h3. Summary
As a user of the Business project, I would like to be able to order the board by any field, similarly to Software projects.

h3. Expected results
Be able to order the issues on the board by a chosen field.

h3. Actual results
No ordering is possible other than the default "oldest to newest by creation date".
fields.summary: Allow ordering of Business project

fields.description:
h3. Current Behaviour

Currently, the *Create classic business projects permission* is only available in the global permissions when the SEN has no other Jira product other than Jira Work Management.

- In case, the cloud instance has a *Jira Software or Jira Service Management* license, in addition, this global permission to create the Business Project will not be available and is substituted with the *Administer Jira* permission.

h3. Expected behavior
It is always not intended to include all the users or stakeholders/clients in the Administer Jira* global permission, so irrespective of the product license, a cloud instance has, the *Create classic business projects Global Permission*  should be present in every instance, similar to have specific permission to create a nextgen project.
fields.summary: Create classic business projects permission should be present in all instances irrespective of product licenses

fields.description:
Hello.

I would really like the ability to nest linked issues under a chosen issue type in the timelines of Work Management Projects.
fields.summary: Nest Linked Issues

fields.description:
I want to use a Core project for a purchase tracking solution and I love the ability to have timelines, calendars, forms and boards all in a single project but our staff are used to just sending an email to get what they want.

It would be nice to be able to have a mechanism like the one in Service Management to receive requests via an email address and have the issues created from received emails.
fields.summary: Email to issue creation for Core Projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When creating an issue from the calendar view, the default due date does not align with the date picker setting

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In https://<site>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/AdvancedApplicationProperties.jspa, set the properties as following:
 ** jira.date.picker.java.format: yyyy/MM/dd
 ** jira.date.picker.javascript.format: %Y/%m/%d
 !Screen Shot 2021-06-11 at 11.56.07.png|thumbnail! 
 # Navigate to a business project's Calendar view
 # Click a date to show the create issue screen

h3. Expected Results
The default date for the due date is in yyyy/MM/dd format

h3. Actual Results
The default date for the due date is still using d/MMM/yy. 
 !Screen Shot 2021-06-11 at 11.56.24.png|thumbnail! 

Since this format does not align with the date picker setting, user has to select a date from the picker again, or they will see an error when clicking "Create".
 !Screen Shot 2021-06-11 at 11.59.06.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When creating an issue from the calendar view, the default due date does not align with the date picker setting

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Timeline view is not displaying issues based on start/end date
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Drag and Drop issues from the List/Board view as by default Timeline is ranked by Issue ID and this will trigger the sort by start/end date

h3. Expected Results

Sort issues in Timeline by start/end date
h3. Actual Results

Sorts by issue id
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: The Timeline view is not displaying issues based on start/end date

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In the Calendar view, issues in a completed state are highlighted in green by default but you have no way of hidden these issues from the Calendar in case you only wish to see items still in progress.

h3. Proposed solution

The option to filter by statuses should be added to only show Done, To Do or In Progress issues in any combination. Perhaps something similar to quick filters.
fields.summary: Option to hide or show completed issues

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
After creating a new JWM project, Timeline on this project not loading and an error message appears:
{code}
Something's gone wrong
Try refreshing or navigating to another page. If you still see this message, our service might be disrupted. Check our
status for updates.
ERROR: YWUM8R
{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Create a JWM project with a template from one of the below projects:
* Content Management 
* Recruitment
* Document Approval
* Lead Tracking
* Procurement
* New employee onboarding
* Sales pipeline
2. Create an issue under the project
3. Go to *Timeline* 

h3. Expected Results
Timeline should load

h3. Actual Results
Timeline not loading. Error message appears: 
"Something's gone wrong"

h3. Workaround
Add issue type sub-task under the project:
* Go to your project > Project settings > Issue types > Actions > Edit issue types
* Drag and drop "Sub-task" issue type from "Available issue types" column to "Issue Types for Current Scheme"
* Save
fields.summary: JWM Timeline view fails if no subtask type exists

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
List view breaks because a priority icon points to a wrong URL

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Deliberately break the URL pointing to a priority icon. You can use this example:
 blob:[https://www.google.com/404]
 # Try to load a JWM project's list view

h3. Expected Results

Something like this:

!image-2021-06-04-15-42-01-142.png|width=1205,height=199!
h3. Actual Results

!image-2021-06-04-15-41-10-085.png|width=1201,height=208!

(the plus button to add columns and the issue filter do not work in this case either)

 

The below exception is thrown in Splunk:
{noformat}
[GraphQL error]: Message: Exception while fetching data (/jiraBusinessAvailableFields/edges[0]/node/fields/edges[14]/node/priorities) : IllegalArgumentException(MalformedURLException(IllegalStateException(MalformedURLException(NumberFormatException)))) requestId=bc9b81b5-1d51-4028-9124-1b7c02a74d89 errorId=6dcbdd93-482d-457a-9c29-aec9d4851fc5, Location: [object Object], Path: jiraBusinessAvailableFields,edges,0,node,fields,edges,14,node,priorities
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Fix the URL or select one of the built-in icons in Jira (clicking [select image])
fields.summary: Broken priority icon causes the list view not to load properly

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Form fails to load when Attachment permission is not set/granted and there is no error message. Just a blank page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# under a Business/JWM Project > Project settings > Permissions
 # do not grant *Attachment* permission
# set a *Form* under your project
# click *Preview*

h3. Expected Results
If the Attachment permission was not granted intentionally, allow the Form creation whilst preventing uploading an attachment as per selected permissions

h3. Actual Results
Form appears blank with no error message/indication that Attachment permission is currently preventing the form from loading

h3. Workaround
Set attachment permissions to allow form submission.
fields.summary: Form fails to load when Attachment permission is not set

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Selecting a date of start/end in the Timeline view reduces the selected value in 1 day

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a Business project
 # Head to the Timeline view
 # Select a date range for an issue
 # Change the start or end date and see that the selected value is the selected one -1 day

h3. Expected Results
Date value should be kept as the one selected

h3. Actual Results
Date value is the one selected -1 day

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Selecting a date of start/end in the Timeline view reduces the selected value in 1 day

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

We cannot see done ✅ issues in the Calendar section
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make sure the issue has a *Due Date* set and transition the issue to Done status
 # Go to Calendar, issue disappear from the Calendar view

h3. Expected Results

We should see the Done status issues as well in the Calendar view same as issues in other statuses
h3. Actual Results

Done issues are not visible in Calendar view
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: "Done" items disappeared from Calendar view in Business project

fields.description:
Timeline/List should be nested showing parent/children relationship, similar to what's done in the roadmaps for software projects.

 !image-2021-05-31-13-29-42-882.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Nested Timeline/List

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When selecting a Due date in the month of June, it is reflected wrongly as July.
The Calendar tab also displays July twice.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Update the due date on an issue under a Business project as 3rd June
# Check teh date on the Board

h3. Expected Results
Due date should show "Jun 3"

h3. Actual Results
Due date showing as "Jul 3"

→ This will be the same for any June Due date.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: A June Due Date is reflected as July on JWM/Business Board

fields.description: As it stands right now, the only supported fields for displaying issues on the calendar or setting a timeline are start date and due date. I would like to be able to define different custom date fields to be used instead, for instance, onboarding/offboarding date
fields.summary: Ability to define different start date and due date fields on calendar/timeline views

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently it is not possible to reorder columns in Jira work management - list feature. 

We will have to use it in order that the system defined. Any new column added would be at th end we cannot move it as per our requirement.
h3. Expected Results

To be able to reorder columns 
h3. Actual Results

!image-2021-05-28-20-14-38-844.png|width=284,height=115!
h3. Workaround

Required, if there is no workaround please state:
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Re-ordering columns in list

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When the issue types are translated and we try to filter tickets on the List, it doesn’t show the results.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Translate Issue types (Tested with Portuguese and French).
 # Change your profile language to the desired language.

h3. Expected Results

When filtering tickets by issue type, it will show the filtered tickets.

!1.png|width=277,height=196!

!2.png|width=277,height=191!

!3 .png|width=284,height=216!

!4.png|width=281,height=283!
h3. Actual Results

The filter doesn’t return tickets, even though they exist on the list. 

If we hover the mouse over the issue type, it shows the corrected translated name.

On Filters > Advanced search it works normally.

Filtering by status and priority (also translated) it works.
h3. Workaround


 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: List doesn’t filter translated Issue Types

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Per

[https://support.atlassian.com/jira-core-cloud/docs/create-a-business-project-as-a-user/]

Having *Jira Work Management* on *Standard* subscription should allow configuring the *Create classic business projects* Global Permission 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add *Jira Work Management* on *Standard* subscription at the *Administration* page:
!image-2021-05-21-17-24-02-108.png|width=472,height=266!
 # Access the *Global Permissions* section from Jira

h3. Expected Results

Be able to configure the *Create classic business projects* Global Permission 
h3. Actual Results

No *Create classic business projects* Global Permission is displayed:

!image-2021-05-21-17-23-43-980.png|width=573,height=189!
h3. Workaround

There is no workaround at this moment.
fields.summary: Create classic business projects Global Permission is not available

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When adding an unsupported field that is required in the Forms, you can no longer preview the form and it would appear as unavailable.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to the field configuration of a project and make an unsupported field *_Required_* (eg. Security Level)
# Go to the Forms of said project and add the field to the form
# Click on *Preview*

After following those steps you should see the following message:
{panel:bgColor=#ffffcc}
(!) *This form contains unsupported required fields*, which will prevent respondents to submit critical information. Please [contact your administrator|https://featureflagjunkie.atlassian.net/secure/ContactAdministrators!default.jspa] to make these fields optional.
{panel}

Making the field *_Required_* is a needed step to replicate this because without it, you actually can't add an unsupported field to the form.

h3. Expected Results

A preview of the form should load in a new tab and if the field is unsupported, it should be locked or indicate that the field is unsupported.

h3. Actual Results

The preview is loaded in a new tab with a "*Form is unavailable*" message.

 !Form_submission_-_Task_tracking_-_Jira.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Change the requirement of the unsupported field to *_Optional_*.
fields.summary: Cannot preview form when an unsupported field is required

fields.description:
{panel}This is a limitation by design as mentioned in the documentation page [View your work in a list|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-core-cloud/docs/view-your-work-in-a-list/]:
 "You can currently only add single line text fields, URLs and user types. [Learn more about setting up custom fields.|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-cloud-administration/docs/create-a-custom-field/]" and due to this this request was converted from Bug to Suggestion to gauge the interest in having all field types available here.{panel}

h3. Issue Summary
Lists do not show certain custom field types in the Column selection
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Custom Fields
 # Create several custom fields of different types (Text Single line, Text Multiline, Date, etc): !image-2021-05-14-15-40-11-332.png|thumbnail! 
 # Add the new fields to the screen of your project: !image-2021-05-14-15-38-29-684.png|thumbnail! 
 # Go to your project Lists, and try to add the new custom fields as new columns using the "+" icon:   !image-2021-05-14-15-36-10-791.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

All the new custom fields are shown and can be added as a column.
h3. Actual Results

Only Single line text custom fields appear in the list:

 !image-2021-05-14-15-39-29-096.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Lists do not show certain custom field types in the Column selection

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
For some reason, issues can't be open in dialog from JWM board in some scenarios.
We weren't able to determine what causes this yet, however, the following JS error is displayed in the console when clicking on a card:
{code}

    at Array.forEach (<anonymous>)
    at actor-middleware.js:12

s @ action-blocker-middleware.js:87

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a JWM board
 # Click in a card to see it in dialog

h3. Expected Results
Card dialog should open

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Can't open issues in dialog from JWM board

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The background color setting of a project is reflected in other business projects. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create two business projects (project A and project B)
 # Change the background color of project A
 # Change the project from project A to project B

h3. Expected Results
The background color of project B is white (If this project has just been created)

h3. Actual Results
The background color of project B is the one set in project A.
 [^AtlassianSupport 2021-05-12 13.53.29.mov] 

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: The background color setting of a project is reflected in other business projects.

fields.description:
Would have been nice to be able to flag Business project tasks with an "Impediment" flag similar to Software project tasks.

Documentation for Software: https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/flag-an-issue/
fields.summary: Option to Flag Business project issues

fields.description:
Currently, Jira Work Management projects only allow users to have one board for the project.

It would be nice to have the option to have multiple boards just like in Company managed projects.
fields.summary: Ability to have multiple boards in a Jira Work Management project

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Add item button in list page from Business board disappears in Safari browser

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In a work management project (Business) go to the list page and click on add item
 # Click outside the field and try to select again add item
https://share.getcloudapp.com/Z4uo4p9Z

h3. Expected Results
The Add item should always be available as it is on chrome

h3. Actual Results
The button disappears

h3. Workaround
Works fine in Chrome or Firefox
fields.summary: Add item button in list page from Business board disappears in Safari browser

fields.description:
h3. *Problem*

Currently, when creating a form and sharing with someone, the tickets will be created following the default issue type of the project. It's not possible to change the issue type directly on the form.

*Suggestion*

Ability to select the Issue type for the Form.
fields.summary: Ability to change the default issue type for Forms

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In Jira Work Management, company managed business project board, for any issues that appear on that board, you should have the ability to right click the issuekey that appears on the card as if it were a hyperlink that will lead you directly to a page URL of that issue itself.
Presently, you cannot do this.  Instead when you hover over the issuekey there is no hyperlink available on the card itself.  Only after left clicking the card can you then see a hyperlink within the issuekey that appears on that modal popup screen that is displayed.  

h3. Suggested Solution
Insert a hyperlink into the issuekey element on the card so that users can directly open that issue into a new tab if they want to.

h3. Why this is important
Consistency between Jira products.
Cards having issuekeys that exist as a hyperlink is something that has always existed across all other board types in Jira Software (kanban and scrum across both team managed and company managed projects). So it really feels like this should exist as a matter of consistency of use.

h3. Workaround 
If you left click on the card itself, a modal popup of the issue will appear on the screen. From there you can right-click the issuekey in top left corner to then open this issue into a new browser tab
fields.summary: The issuekey on a work management business project board should appear as a hyperlink to that issue

fields.description: For companies that use agile methodologies across the business, it would be helpful to have better support of the Epic and story issue type in the Jira Work Management project templates. Plus, advanced roadmaps expects it. You can add these issue types, but the fields required for the Epic aren't supported in the form. And the hierarchy doesn't display in the list or timeline. The hierarchy displays nicely in Advanced roadmap if you have an epic set up, but if you don't, and you just have a task with subtasks, it categorizes the work under "issues with no parent." So it's sub-optimal no matter which way you do it.
fields.summary: Support Epics and Stories in Jira Work Management Cloud
Ability to support all fields under Forms

fields.description:
We would like to see the customer build out like the competitor section and be able to tie paid enhancement to the customer records, products the customers have and then tie the customer visit section to the customer as well.  

Is there anything in the roadmap on this section. Of all the areas in Align, this is one that is really lacking functionality and we build for the customers. 

 

I had to choose a component and none of them fit this request, so I just added one.
fields.summary: Customer Portal

fields.description:
I could not find Align in the drop-down selection. 

In Align the Customer area is really lacking. The competitor details are what I would like to see for clients. I would like to be able to tie the features to customers and then from the customer I would like to see Customer Visits, what is the status of the features for the customers etc.  We get many paid enhancement from clients and these features need to be tracked, currently, the only way to do this is with labels.   Also, I had to select a component, but again nothing for Align is in the dropdown.
fields.summary: Jira Algin

fields.description: As a user, I'd like to create more than one form per project. At this moment, we can just create one form per project.
fields.summary: Ability to create more than one form per project
Swimlanes for JIRA Core

fields.description:
We use the business project for teams that do not directly work with the codebase and as such do not need or want the features that come along with a software project.
The roadmap being available on the business project would allow us to better plan the workload of non-development teams.
fields.summary: Enable Roadmap feature in Classic Business projects

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, business board have a limit of 1000 issues. The boards will display the first 1000 issues added to it, so newly created issues are not displayed.

h3. Suggested Solution

Increase the limit of issues that can be displayed in Business Boards.

h3. Why this is important

Users that have a lot of issues in a project can still use Jira Core boards. Better Management for Core teams.
 
h3. Workaround 

Create a Jira Software Project, since Software boards allow 5000 issues, and bulk move all the tickets to the new project.

There's no workaround on the Business Board.
fields.summary: Allow more than 1000 issues on Business Boards

fields.description:
*Summary*

At the moment, JIRA Core board cards do not display priority icons.
According to this [Atlassian blog post|https://www.atlassian.com/blog/jira-core/jira-core-means-business-introducing-boards-and-mobile-apps], the information that is displayed by default on the cards, are:

- Name of the task
- Assignee 
- Due date

*Suggestion*

As a user, it would be great to have the ability to display priority icons on Board cards for JIRA Core boards.
It makes much easier to see important and critical issues. The ability to select/filter which priority levels actually display on the cards is also important to this functionality.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to customize card layout for JIRA Core boards

fields.description:
Problem Description
Currently, the issues will disappear in 2 weeks(14 days) when it gets marked as DONE from the core board

Suggested Resolution
Functionality should be given to the user to change the particular setting
fields.summary: Functionality to change 14 days disappearing setting from the board for the completed issues.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63025].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Description

There is no way to disable JIRA Core board on Business type project and some times, users would like to disable this feature.

h3. Suggested Resolution

Provide an option to disable JIRA Core board.
fields.summary: An option to disable JIRA Core board

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Case 1:
For leading tracking (a use case specifically support by JIRA), having
items on the board for more than 14 days is extremely common. In some
cases, this can easily be up to 6 months.

Case 2:
A customer has too many issues in his "Done" column and wants to remove them before the 14 days term

h3. Suggested Solution

Make it possible to configure a Core board to show issues for more than 14 days.
Make it possible to remove issues from a Core board before the 14 days term.
fields.summary: Ability to configure Core board to show issues for more than 14 days and remove issues before 14 days

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In Jira Cloud, the Coreboards currently only allow you to see issues of standard issue types.  There is no current way to force this board into showing issues that are subtasks.   

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow option to show subtasks on coreboards.

h3. Why this is important
Users cannot see subtasks that might exist in that project when looking at this board.  Since subtasks and their parent issues do not always have to have correlating statuses, it is possible that all the parent issues could be marked as completed when there are several subtasks that have not be completed.   It would be helpful to be able to see these on this board.
fields.summary: Coreboards should have the option to show subtasks

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62667].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

It would be great if the new business boards could show sub-tasks.

Here is an example of the board:

!business board.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution

-
 
h3. Workaround 

-
fields.summary: Business boards show sub-tasks.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Having a workflow validator configured, the error set doesn't display if you try to move an issue card between two columns. It displays correctly if you transition the issue using the status selector

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure a workflow validator
# At the board, try to move the issue card that will trigger the workflow validator to the next column
# The issue will return without any warning

h3. Expected Results
The workflow validator message should be displayed that the issue was not transitioned due to a missing information

h3. Actual Results
The issue returns to the original status and doesn't warn why.

h3. Workaround

Instead of using the issue card transitioning between the columns, use the status selector inside the issue. However, this require to open the issue and transition using the status
fields.summary: Workflow validator is not warning when transitioning issues through the columns

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The *Hide From User Condition* is not working when moving Issues on the Board
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure a Hide From User Condition in any Transition
 # Publish the changes
 # Try to Transition Issue using the Status button
 # Try to Transition Issue drag it into the Board 

h3. Expected Results

The Transition will be blocked for users
h3. Actual Results

The Transition is blocked when using the Status button but is possible to Transition the Issue dragging into the Board.

Here is an example:

I added a *Hide From User Condition* to the *In Progress* - *To Do* Transition:

!image-2020-07-08-12-56-18-290.png|width=574,height=463!

The Transition is not visible on the Status button but you can Transition the Issue using the Board:

[^screencast-starless.atlassian.net-2020.07.08-12_51_20.webm]
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Hide From User Condition not working when moving Issues on the Board

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
With a release version, set in a business project, after accessing another business project then accessing the release once again, it throws a error in page: Permission Violation as you can see on the following video: https://share.getcloudapp.com/ApuAWeJK 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a release version in a business project
# Access a dashboard with Jira Issue Calendar Gadget and copy the link from the release version displayed there.
# Access another business project not the one from the release
# Try to access the release link once again

h3. Expected Results
The user is able to access the release.

h3. Actual Results
The user isn't able to access the release and reaches an error page reporting the following error: 
{code}
Permission Violation
It seems that you have tried to perform an operation which you are not permitted to perform.
If you think this message is wrong, null.
{code}

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. The user can access the release normally by accessing the release version's project first, then accessing the release.
fields.summary: After accessing a business project, Permission Violation error when trying to access a release from another business project

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a subtask is created for a task created from a Business project board and navigated back to the parent task the description of the subtask is copied to the parent task.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Take any Business project board.
 # Create a task from the board using the + symbol. Fill the summary and description.
 # Create a subtask for this task and then close the subtask.
 # Click the parent task. You will see that the description of the subtask is copied to the parent task.

h3. Expected Results

The parent task description should show correctly.
h3. Actual Results

The parent task is showing the description of the subtask.
h3. Workaround

Do a refresh of the browser.
fields.summary: Creating subtask in a Business project board task is causing the parent task description to show incorrectly.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When trying to *Rank* Issues on a Business project Board the changes get reverted when refreshing the page.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to a Business project
 # Reorder the Issues on one column
 # Refresh the page

h3. Expected Results

Issues should keep the order per:
{quote}Order and prioritize

You can move items around within a column, which lets you order tasks any way you like, such as by priority, complexity, or due date.
{quote}
[https://support.atlassian.com/jira-core-cloud/docs/work-with-boards-in-business-projects/]
h3. Actual Results

Please see the attached video:
[^screencast-starless.atlassian.net-2020.10.22-18_22_01.webm]
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Ranking on Business projects is not working

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The due date value is different in issue card in board (-1d) vs. issue detail view for *Business* projects:

https://share.getcloudapp.com/geubwd5e

Additional notes:

* This does affect Jira Software projects.
* When the date is shown as “today” or “tomorrow”, the due dates in card and issue view match.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a business project.
 # Add issues with due date.
 # Go to the project board and check the due date displayed on the issue card and compare with the due date displayed in the issue detail view.

h3. Expected Results

Due date should be the same that is set by the user and shown in issue view.

h3. Actual Results

Due date is shown as -1d the value that was set.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Due Date are being shown -1d in Jira Core boards cards

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Subtask cannot be opened in the board pop-up view

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In the board click on an issue with subtasks
 # Try to open the issue in the same pop-up view by clicking on the summary
 
Video example:
https://share.getcloudapp.com/v1ubO9R4

h3. Expected Results
The subtask should open in the same pop-up view

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens

h3. Workaround
You can click on the issue key and the subtask will be open on a new page
fields.summary: Subtasks cannot be opened in the board pop-up view in business projects

fields.description:
Summary: Ability to create Multiple Jira Business List View on a single business project.

It would be great for us to be able to create multiple Jira Business List views on a single business project just like how we can create multiple Boards on a Jira Software Project.
fields.summary: Ability to create multiple Jira Business List views on a single business project.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Having more than 100 issues in one load breaks the Calendar in Business Projects.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Have more than 100 issues in a single month/day/page load

h3. Expected Results
The calendar loads normally.

h3. Actual Results
The calendar loads partially and then throws an error, and in the network tab of the dev tools we can see an error 400:
 !image-2021-04-16-16-08-25-847.png|thumbnail! 
From Dev tools in the network tab:
{code}{sentFrom: "jira.frontend.jira-business.calendar.services.calendar-view-items",…}
browserName: "Chrome"
browserVersion: "89.0"
buildKey: "JF-PROD-23059"
event: {,…}
logTime: "2021-04-15T12:16:14.208Z"
message: "Failed to fetch issues for calendar view"
sentFrom: "jira.frontend.jira-business.calendar.services.calendar-view-items"{code}

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Having more than 100 issues in one load breaks the Calendar in Business Projects.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Issues are appearing on boards of business projects with due date -1.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a business project.
# Add issues with any due date.
# Go to the project board and check the due date.
Video example:
https://share.getcloudapp.com/DOuDrzvP

h3. Expected Results
The due date should be the same on the board and inside the issue

h3. Actual Results
The issue is appearing with due date -1 on the board

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Issues are appearing in business board with due date -1.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When I am logging time I spent I am required to put in the Date started and how much time. It can be quite tedious to work out when exactly I started based on the time I spent.

I would find it useful if there was a feature and I was able to put "Date Finished" which then i could put the time and day for now, in return the program would work out when I started based on the amount of "Time Spent" I put.
fields.summary: As a user add a feature to choose Date finished instead of Started
